Sample.Title: Angular single-page application calling a protected web API and using App Roles to implement Role-Based Access Control

AppRoles.Name: TaskAdmin
AppRoles.Description: Admins can read any user's todo list

AppRoles.Name: TaskUser
AppRoles.Description: Users can read and modify their todo lists

ManualSteps.Comment: To receive the `roles` claim with the name of the app roles this user is assigned to, make sure that the user accounts you plan to sign-in to this app is assigned to the app roles of this service instance. The guide, https://aka.ms/userassignmentrequired provides step by step instructions.
Or you can run the ..\CreateUsersAndAssignRoles.ps1 command to automatically create a number of users, and assign these users to the app roles of this app.

AppRoles.Name: TaskAdmin
AppRoles.Description: Admins can read any user's todo list

AppRoles.Name: TaskUser
AppRoles.Description: Users can read and modify their todo lists

ManualSteps.Comment: Navigate to the portal and set the 'replyUrlsWithType' to 'Spa' in the application manifest

To receive the `roles` claim with the name of the app roles this user is assigned to, make sure that the user accounts you plan to sign-in to this app is assigned to the app roles of this SPA app. The guide, https://aka.ms/userassignmentrequired provides step by step instructions.
Or you can run the ..\CreateUsersAndAssignRoles.ps1 command to automatically create a number of users, and assign these users to the app roles of this app.

Mappings.key: Enter the domain of your Azure AD tenant, e.g. contoso.onmicrosoft.com
Enter the ID of your Azure AD tenant copied from the Azure portal
Enter the application ID (clientId) of the 'TodoListAPI' application copied from the Azure portal
